New Records: Malik Monk scored 31 points, the highest for the Kings in the game; DeMar DeRozan added 29 points; De'Aaron Fox contributed 23 points; Jaylen Wells scored 30 for the Grizzlies; Jarren Jackson Jr. scored 28; Zach Edey returned from a two-game absence and had nine points and seven rebounds; the Kings won their third game in a row; the Kings led 78-72 at halftime and 102-100 after three quarters; the Grizzlies took a 110-109 lead with two free throws by Scottie Pippen Jr. at 7:56 of the fourth quarter; the Kings later regained the lead with a 20-10 run, capped by a 3-pointer by Monk with 4:21 remaining; Devin Carter made his debut with the Kings in the first quarter
Key Match Events: The game was tied 100-100 after three quarters; the Grizzlies took a 110-109 lead; the Kings responded with a 20-10 run to regain the lead; Malik Monk made a key 3-pointer with 4:21 remaining
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings and Grizzlies combined for 150 points in the first half; the Kings made 29 of 59 shots (52.7%) and the Grizzlies made 26 of 50 shots (52%); the teams made 17 3-pointers combined in the first quarter; the Kings had 21 assists in the first half with three players having four or more; the Grizzlies surged back to tie the game 100-100 on two free throws by Jackson with 1:27 left in the third quarter
